narrative.title: 5Th Indian Division - 1942Q2
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Indian Army) deployed in North Africa during 1942Q2.
narrative.objectives: Standard infantry division with significant combat experience from East African and Western Desert campaigns. Experienced in both offensive and defensive operations in desert conditions.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Egyptian Delta (rear area) - flat agricultural terrain, some desert fringe areas

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Multi-national composition (British, Indian, Gurkha, East African troops)
Extensive desert warfare experience from Eritrea and Keren campaigns (1941)
Experience in night operations and close-quarter combat

environment.terrain_type: Egyptian Delta (rear area) - flat agricultural terrain, some desert fringe areas
